medical_history.chief_complaint: Management of adenocarcinoma of the gastroesophageal junction.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Chest and epigastric discomfort developed approximately 2 months before evaluation after eating solid foods, lasting from minutes to an hour. There was no difficulty swallowing liquids.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had gastroesophageal reflux disease for 3 years, hypertension, mild arthritis, and postpartum urinary incontinence.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of encephalitis at 54 years, mother died of a myocardial infarct in her 60s, brother died of lung cancer at 52 years.
medical_history.social_history: Lived with husband, worked at home, was fully active (ECOG performance status of 0). Drank alcoholic beverages rarely, smoked cigarettes for 25 years but stopped 20 years earlier, did not use illicit drugs.
